## BaseClient.sendMsg() method

Send message, without response, not ensuring the server is received and processed correctly.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
sendMsg<T extends keyof ServiceType['msg']>(msgName: T, msg: ServiceType['msg'][T], options?: TransportOptions): Promise<{
        isSucc: true;
    } | {
        isSucc: false;
        err: TsrpcError;
    }>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  msgName | T |  |
|  msg | ServiceType\['msg'\]\[T\] | Message body |
|  options | [TransportOptions](./tsrpc-base-client.transportoptions.md) | Transport options |

<b>Returns:</b>

Promise&lt;{ isSucc: true; } \| { isSucc: false; err: TsrpcError; }&gt;

If the promise is resolved, it means the request is sent to system kernel successfully. Notice that not means the server received and processed the message correctly.
